messages.title: Making a difference locally and nationally...
messages.content: Harriet campaigned for the Transport Secretary to give an early start date for the East London Line Phase 2B which will link Denmark Hill, Peckham Rye and Queens Road Peckham to the London Overground and New Cross by 2012. She is now demanding Tory Mayor Boris Johnson protects the South London Line.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I set up and lead the Southwark Police 1,000 campaign which aimed to go from 775 police to 1,000. We now have 1,028, but I will keep up the campaign.
The Labour government has put more money into public transport. I will make sure that continues.
I will press for more youth clubs and youth workers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Helping local people with their problems
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will continue to hold my regular advice surgeries and to answer emails, calls and letters within 10 working days.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Working for all the different communities in Southwark
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will continue to work with people who have been born and brought up in Southwark and all our diverse communities.

mentions.candidate: Harriet Harman has been our MP for many years and is very experienced.

housing.content: Campaigning with local people, and Labour councillors, Harriet succeeded in getting the government to give Camberwell Baths a £1.4 million fresh start.

politicalExperience.achievements: Successfully campaigned for transport links and worked on various community issues.

images.caption: Harriet Harman with the Minister for Pensions at a meeting in Walworth
